description.@value: The data veracity component makes the trust and accountability relationship in dataspace scenarios symmetric: while consent agreements constrain what a data consumer is allowed to do with received data, veracity agreements capture the agreed-on key quality properties of the data made available by data producers. To that end, the building block enables parties to strike and manage data veracity agreements for a wide range of data properties, using a common, semantically supported descriptive approach and formulated as Verifiable Credentials. The building block also supports the verification of data veracity through a range of verification models.

functionalities.@value: Provide means to verify the veracity of shared data (multiple supported models; see description)
